official-title.#text:
To require the Secretary of Health and Human Services to
		  promulgate regulations regarding the authorship, content, format, and
		  dissemination of Patient Medication Information to ensure patients receive
		  consistent and high-quality information about their prescription medications
		  and are aware of the potential risks and benefits of prescription
		  medications.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Cody Miller Initiative for Safer
			 Prescriptions Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:505D

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Chapter V of the Federal Food, Drug, and
			 Cosmetic Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/ch:V

header.#text:
Patient
			 medication information for prescription drugs

Patient
				medication information for prescription drugs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall issue regulations regarding the authorship,
				content, format, and dissemination requirements for patient medication
				information (referred to in this section as

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:503/ss:b/p:1

text.#text:
Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of
				this section, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall require that the PMI with
				respect to a drug—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:505E/ss:a

text.#text:
The
				regulations promulgated under

be scientifically
				accurate and based on the professional labeling approved by the Secretary and
				authoritative, peer-reviewed literature; and

includes
				nontechnical, understandable, plain language that is not promotional in tone or
				content, and contains at least—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
) and as a drug that is the subject of an
				approved abbreviated new drug application under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:505/ss:j/p:2/sp:A

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
or of an
				approved license for a biological product submitted under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:505/ss:j

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 351(k) of the
				Public Health Service Act

text.#text:
the established
				name of drug, including the established name of such drug as a listed drug (as
				described in

drug uses and
				clinical benefits;

general directions
				for proper use;

contraindications,
				common side effects, and most serious risks of the drug, especially with
				respect to certain groups such as children, pregnant women, and the
				elderly;

when a patient
				should contact his or her health care professional;

instructions not
				to share medications, and, if any exist, key storage requirements, and
				recommendations relating to proper disposal of any unused portion of the drug;
				and

known clinically
				important interactions with other drugs and substances.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:505E/ss:a

text.#text: The regulations promulgated under

ensuring that
				common information is applied consistently and simultaneously across similar
				drug products and for drugs within classes of medications in order to avoid
				patient confusion and harm; and

developing a
				process, including consumer testing, to assess the quality and effectiveness of
				PMI in ensuring that PMI promotes patient understanding and safe and effective
				medication use.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
				provide for the development of a publicly accessible electronic repository for
				all PMI documents and content to facilitate the availability of
				PMI.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:505E/ss:a

text.#text: The regulations promulgated under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall publish on the Internet Web site
			 of the Food and Drug Administration a link to the Daily Med Web site
			 (http://dailymed.nlm.nih.gov/dailymed) (or any successor Web site).
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services
